text: {"grade": 1, "reasoning": "The criterion requires the response to advise that the defence will fail if the client's use of force was not to avert an imminent or immediately apprehended attack. Section 3 of the response, under 'Elements of the Self-Defence Test,' explicitly lists 'Unlawful Attack / Imminent Threat' as the first element, stating: 'The threat must be present or imminent \u2013 not a remote or speculative danger.' Furthermore, the table referencing case law includes R v Bird [1995] 1 Cr App R 115, which 'Emphasises the immediacy requirement \u2013 the threat must be present or imminent.' This directly addresses the core requirement mentioned in the criterion.", "criterion_id": "74ca3b09-c13e-4143-b0da-ede48e93caee"}
